result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen A. Tolbert Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephen A. Tolbert Jr. in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he contacted the State Public Defenders Office over two weeks ago. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CM523, 22CT455 & 22CT465

Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Stephen A. Tolbert Jr. in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Total bond to cover all cases. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
